note: and developed in relation to ‘victory’ and ‘arrival’ rituals by McCormick (1986).
title: discusses the influence of churchmen on kings, and Robinson

examines the papacy’s view of its relationship with rulers, including the doctrines of the ‘two powers’ and the ‘two swords’. The most full-blooded case for pagan beliefs underlying royal power even after conversion to Christianity is made by Chaney
but there is a classic, succinct discussion by Binchy
The importance of Rome to the ideology of barbarian kings is set out by Wormald
